quizDescription: Test your knowledge about the soulful Marvin Gaye, his timeless music, and his profound impact on the world of soul and R&B!
quizTags: Marvin Gaye, Music, Soul, R&B, Motown

questions.question: What is Marvin Gaye's full name?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye's full name is Marvin James Gaye Jr. He was born on April 2, 1939, in Washington, D.C.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye signed with which iconic record label, where he achieved immense success and became known as the 'Prince of Motown'?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye signed with Motown Records, where he achieved immense success and became known as the 'Prince of Motown.' Motown played a significant role in shaping his career.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye's iconic album 'What's Going On' was released in which year?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye's iconic album 'What's Going On' was released in 1971. The album was a critical and commercial success and is considered one of the greatest albums of all time.

questions.question: Which of Marvin Gaye's songs became an anthem for the environmental movement and earned him a Grammy Award nomination?
options: I Heard It Through the Grapevine
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye's song 'Mercy Mercy Me (The Ecology)' became an anthem for the environmental movement and earned him a Grammy Award nomination. The song was released in 1971.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye's duet with Tammi Terrell, 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough,' was released in which year?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye's duet with Tammi Terrell, 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough,' was released in 1967. The song became a huge hit and remains a classic.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye recorded the successful duet 'It Takes Two' with which female singer?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye recorded the successful duet 'It Takes Two' with female singer Kim Weston. The song was released in 1966 and became a hit.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye's sensual and romantic hit song 'Let's Get It On' was released in which year?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye's sensual and romantic hit song 'Let's Get It On' was released in 1973. The song is one of his most well-known and beloved tracks.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye's posthumously released song 'What's Going On' received two Grammy Awards in which year?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye's posthumously released song 'What's Going On' received two Grammy Awards in 1983, several years after his tragic passing. The song remains a powerful and socially conscious anthem.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye's father, Marvin Gay Sr., fatally shot him on which date?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye's father, Marvin Gay Sr., fatally shot him on April 1, 1984, one day before his 45th birthday. The tragic event shocked the world and left a void in the music industry.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye was posthumously inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in which year?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye was posthumously inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1987, honoring his significant contributions to the world of music.
